actions.text: Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.
Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 770.

official_title: A joint resolution directing the Conferees on the Act entitled the "Tax Reform Act of 1986" (H.R. 3838) to require that any amount refunded under section 212 of the Tax Reform Act of 1986 to steel companies filing bankruptcy petitions in 1986 or thereafter be dedicated for the continuation of company-paid health insurance costs for employees, and retired employees.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that the conferees on the bill entitled the "Tax Reform Act of 1986" (H.R. 3838) should require that any amount refunded under such Act to steel companies filing bankruptcy petitions in 1986 or thereafter be dedicated for the continuation of company-paid health insurance costs for employees and retired employees.

titles.title: A joint resolution directing the Conferees on the Act entitled the "Tax Reform Act of 1986" (H.R. 3838) to require that any amount refunded under section 212 of the Tax Reform Act of 1986 to steel companies filing bankruptcy petitions in 1986 or thereafter be dedicated for the continuation of company-paid health insurance costs for employees, and retired employees.
